Correct. The colloid of thyroid follicles iodizes prohormone and stores it for release, while the posterior pituitary stores and releases hormones produced by the neurosecretory cells of hypothalamus but does not produce hormones itself.

body.p: Which of the following glands is NOT a source of a steroid hormone?

feedback.p: Correct. While the anterior pituitary produces tropic hormones that regulate the production of steroid hormones, they and the releasing hormones from the hypothalamus are not themselves steroids.

Incorrect. Two of the cortical zones produce steroid hormones under the influence of tropic hormone ACTH from anterior pituitary and the third zone is also steroid under the influence of the potassium and angiotensin II.
Incorrect. Both estrogen and progesterone are steroid hormones.
Incorrect. Testosterone is a steroid hormone.

hint.p: All of these glands are regulated by tropic hormones.

body.p: Some glands are stimulated by neurons rather than hormones (tropic) or receptors monitoring an internal stimulus that changes (humoral). Which of the following glandâ€™s secretion is NOT regulated by neural stimuli?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The neuron terminals in the posterior pituitary not only stimulate the release of the hormone into the blood, they produce the hormone that is being stored here.
Correct. Insulin and glucagon release are regulated humorally.
Incorrect. The release of melatonin is stimulated directly by impulses from neurons of the retina of the eye.
Incorrect. The sympathetic nervous system has neuron going directly to the adrenal medulla to stimulate release of its hormones.

hint.p: To be directly regulated by the nervous system these glands have axon terminals of neurons directly releasing neurotransmitters to stimulate release of their hormone, not neuortransmitters transported in blood as hormones.
